H0.text: The refractive index is the property that must be considered when light entering thin optical fibers strikes the inner surface at an angle greater than the critical angle.

H1.text: Reflective point is the aspect that requires attention when light entering thin optical fibers strikes the inner surface at an angle greater than the critical angle.

H2.text: The electromagnetic index is the aspect that requires attention when, because optical fibers are thin, entering light may strike the inside surface at greater than the critical angle.

H3.text: Wavelength is the factor that requires attention when light entering thin optical fibers may strike the inside surface at greater than the critical angle.

A4.text: Total internal reflection occurs only when going to a less optically dense material, i.e., one with lower refractive index.
